alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 8:18PM EST until December 24 at 6:49AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until midnight EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 PM EST, Gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall has fallen across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding potential. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Guilford, Howland, Brownville Junction, Milo, Monson, Blanchard, Lake View Plantation, Orneville, Ebeemee, Elliottsville, Licoln Township, Kingsbury Plantation, Enfield, Charleston, Sangerville, Bradford and Brownville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
